cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 95 miles ENE of Daytona Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to continue northward today, then turn N-NE on Thursday and parallel the U.S. East Coast, passing offshore of Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina and the Mid-Atlantic before accelerating past New England toward the Canadian Maritimes.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: possible brush or landfall along the South Carolina or North Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from NC/VA border northward to Chincoteague, VA and lower Chesapeake Bay (well south of New Jersey).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and Tropical-Storm Warnings from the Volusia/Brevard FL line northward to Surf City, NC.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Southeast U.S. coast from Florida through North Carolina, then the Mid-Atlantic and southern New England coasts.
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤5%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 25–35 kt possible Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal departures <2 ft possible along the New Jersey and Delaware coasts; negligible surge in the Delaware River at Camden.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain Friday into early Saturday, generally 1–3 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along the New Jersey shore Friday–Saturday that could hamper pilot/launch operations.
